name: Jeremiah M
text: Finally, a real pinball location with some great up to date games. This place is part of an elementary school that has since been turned into a brewery/restaurant,  a separate bar, an axe throwing room, and some community performance rooms/stages. Visit it if you can. Pretty well maintained games, couple gargepus Valley tables that have a vintage look to them. Had a blast playing here, and I will visit this place again any time I am in Huntsville!!

name: Chelsea Boyd
text:
Was a cool concept at first.. But there weren't very many games to choose from.. I could play whatever video games I want at home for free.
Also, I know they were just doing their job, and being friendly/considerate, but them coming to check up on me, a socially anxious person, every few minutes while I was just trying to get immersed in the game, was kind of nerve-wracking..
It was an all right experience overall.. but I wouldn't really go there again. I don't know why I would.. It just seems mostly for children/preteens and people that are
1. Too lazy/broke to buy their own video game consoles/games
2. Maybe they hope for a social experience

I don't know how much potential the place has for making friends and socializing, though..

The staff was helpful and friendly though and it seems like it would be a great place for children and preteens.. children because there's a ball pit and inflatable? castle thing, and for preteens that want to play video games, but their parents don't want them to get too addicted or to invest in buying a game system for them.

Other stuff:
-You can buy snacks and drinks there..
-Its fun to try, at least once.
-Inexpensive imo.

text: Today we had our first experience at the mall. To say my kids were disappointed would be an understatement...that was until we found this hidden gem!!! $5 gets you 30 minutes of play time. My 4 year old is going crazy for the bounce house and giant ball pit while my 10 year old is playing fortnite.  They give you a table and offer a variety of snacks and drinks for an amazing price. The staff has been very friendly and keeps checking on us and making sure my boys are having a blast!   This is definitely going to be a regular stop for us anytime we are in the area!!

name: Greg Show
text: Everything my wife said is accurate. And everything from the owners response is absolutely twisted, watered down, and false. We we not rude in expressing our concerns with the staff, and were met with rude, patronizing remarks and actions. The sheer fact that you and your staff would lie about the events of that day are a true representation of your business as a whole. “Kid-friendly” music? Since when is rap music with swearing in it kid friendly? And since when is it “kid-friendly” to see the staff members jiving their bodies dancing to the hip hop music in front of my kids? If you want an arcade/game room...fine, but don’t mix it up with an area for toddlers and young ones, and act like you will never get any concerned parents. And like it or not...I don’t care how high rated of a game it is, to have a game featured in your business that glorifies the outright killing of police officers is reprehensible. Have some character and take a stand! That nonsense breeds some of the contempt that people have against those who protect us...and at a young age! And we wonder why there is such a disrespect for authority in our society?! Wow. Anyways, we were very respectful to the staff, the staff was very unhelpful, forceful, rude, then patronizing. Don’t take your little ones there, and don’t expect them to try to make the customer happy...it’s their way or the highway.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback.  We do wonder if you have ever actually been here though, since you have only two Google reviews on your profile, 1 for us and 1 for The Alley at the same exact time.  We are not in competition with The Alley, we want their establishment to succeed as well as ours.  Our hope is that more entertainment offered in our area is good for everyone.  We offer different types of games and do not claim to be the same as The Alley.  We work very hard to keep our arcade clean and sanitized, and make sure that all of our games are up and running at all times.  Some games can't be open because we are trying to maintain social distancing guidelines.  Our goal is for our customers to come in and have fun and forget about some of the stress of the world for a while.  Again, thanks for your review, we welcome you to come and give us another try and will always try our best to improve customer experience.

name: Mike Breeding
text: I was sorely disappointed in the birthday party we scheduled. The party was scheduled 1:00-3:00. We showed up around 12:50 assuming it was going to take 10-15 minutes to get all 6 kids setup and ready to play. Unfortunately that wasn’t the case. The kids didn’t get setup and playing until around 1:40 (leaving only an hour to play).  At 2:40 the kids we sent into the party room to eat pizza and open presents.  At 2:50 the guy came in to inform us that we had to be out of there within 10 minutes.  Keep in mind that we paid for 2 hours of playing for the kids and it took 45+ minutes before they all could start playing. The guy that was working informed us that it normally isn’t this troublesome and he wasn’t sure what was wrong  ( we even had a PC crash in the middle of a game within 5 minutes after we finally got it up and running). I will say the only positive to the experience was how nice the staff was but for $275 I expected to at least get an hour and 40 minutes of playing time before eating and we only received maybe an hours worth.  Not worth the money that was spent.

resp.text: We are so sorry to hear this. If it is okay we would like to contact you and offer 1 hour of free gaming for each child who attended.This is not our standard for our parties and we are so sorry. We do hope you give us another chance to redeem our store. We hope to speak to you soon.

name: Zion Bethel
text:
GREAT GREAT GREAT!! A very unique two story bar experience with great food, a wide selection of alcoholic beverages, and an arcade for the books! The adult equivalent of Dave & Busters! The owner is usually on site and is extremely friendly and passionate about the place, and has plans to expand the arcade to include more activities.

Most games cost .50¢ or no more than $1.00, but the pool tables are free to play and the iceball roller game is as well.

All in all, if you're looking for a fresh and new bar experience that has many friendly faces, isn't too packed, doesn't kill conversation with loud music, and serves food that leaves nothing to be desired, this is the place for you and your friends!

Come grab a drink and play some classic arcade games!

name: Sara Mosier
text:
I've been here twice with my roommates, both times for their children's birthday parties.

The first time was around Aug 2020, and it was pretty dead in the bowling alley.  We were the only customers in there for at least the first hour.  We purchased the 2 hour package, which you get to choose your food from a list, you get several arcade play cards with tokens and a laminated bowling pin for the birthday child.   Any food you don't finish, they allow you to box up and take with you!

Surprisingly,  the food is actually really good.  We had chicken tenders, pizza, and mac n cheese balls the first time, and cheesy bread, chicken tenders and buffalo cauliflower this last time.

The second time we went, which was this month, they were a LOT busier but the experience was still pretty amazing.  Bottom line, both children loved their birthday parties and we would do this for either of them again!

resp.text: Sara thank you for the five-star review about our Bowlero! Looks like you had a great time on the lanes and we appreciate the feedback. Hope you’ll come back to bowl with us again soon!

text: Jarred was awesome at having the party run smoothly and enjoyable. The staff ensured we had enough napkins & drink refills & gave us the plates for the cake. We had our own private area. The pizza was filling & delicious. They had set up Happy Birthday with my daughter's name. I have zero complaints. 100% fully satisfied customer. Booking was easy. The staff answered all questions & accommodated our needs perfectly to our desires. I look forward to coming again. Each child in the party also had a $3 complimentary arcade card which was very much enjoyed after bowling. We are very grateful for our positive experience. Honestly, my expectations were exceeded. Way to go Bowlero. Thank you!  I would definitely recommend this bowling alley for any age or event.

It's got a good mix of classics like ski ball and air hockey with newer electronic games like flappy bird and candy crush.

She was very polite and respectful and got our orders as soon as possible and got it to us quickly. They did seem a little under staffed with the servers with there being a party going on and a good bit of lanes takin and only her there. Its a very clean facility and they have easy to find balls. The food is a bit expensive but well worth it.

If it was more affordable it would have been 5 stars.

text: DO NOT ORDER THE BUFFALO WINGS. They come straight from the fiery pits of hell and will only haunt you while you bowl. Had fun

name: Dan Taylor
text:
My wife and I went along with another couple for a couple of games of late night bowling on a Saturday night.

I have bowled for many years and I've been to many different bowling alleys.

I was impressed with the size and amount of lanes this location had and definitely the house ball selection for those who don't have their own ball. We hadn't planned on visiting the bowling alley while we were in town so I used a house ball this particular evening. The balls are arranged by weight and not just thrown in random spots.

There are large screens with graphics for each lane to keep you entertained.  The location has a bar, arcade, and pool table. The staff was friendly. We'll be going back soon.

name: Mel R.
text: Nice. Clean. Game area was cool. Wait time was a bit much, especially since there were over 10 lanes unoccupied. Supposed tournament, but there wasn't any tournament happening. 😕

text: My wife and I, our daughter and our grandson, 5 years old, spent the evening. And had a great time. It is family oriented people will very helpful and got to talk with others and meet others.

name: Cody Tillery
text:
We went on a Sunday afternoon around 2pm. We ordered a hotdog,hamburger, and a shrimp popper meal which took a whole hour to get to us.
It seems like there were only 4 people working with many of the lanes full. I don't know if people called out but management should have found fill ins instead of running their employees ragged.
We had a much better experience coming here on a Saturday night than a less busy Sunday afternoon.

name: CARLOS ANDERSON
text: Customer service is lacking here. The lane I was on kept having issues and it took forever for the STAFF to respond and address the matter.

name: Ed Higdon
text: The place was fine but we had a set time frame in which to bowl. Not a big deal to get a couple games in before the time ran out, except for the fact that the lane quit working a number of times. Changing lanes didn't seem to matter for the people who started next to us because they moved from a lane that kept messing up to a lane that was messing up worse. That said, we decided to take our chances. Several times it took the staff as much as 10-12 minutes to get it working again because more than once I watched them hanging out chatting with other employees at the desk for more than 5 minutes after being told it had quit again. We didn't have any issues with the lanes at the other place in town so we went there a couple times more recently. It cost less with a groupon anyway I believe.

name: Selena Manning
text: The food was good! A little pricey for everything but we had fun! The bathrooms were clean and they had a lot to do beside bowl. Very nice facility!

name: Ethan Winters
text: Very fun and entertaining place. Music on projectors in back of bowling alleys is a plus. Lazertag course is top of the line and they even have tourneys! First time we went the lazer tag was unoperational but the manager gave us free passes to lazer tag and a gift card with 10 free credits to the arcade! The college student special for bowling was an extreme help considering me and my friends were on a budget. Extremely friendly staff and lots of cool stuff to do. Cheap prices make this a very enjoyable outing and i will definitely be visiting again. 100/10 would reccomend.

name: Matt Malecki
text: You get, what you expecting and more.

name: jess horton
text:
Pros: front desk staff was super nice, place was clean, and had well kept bathrooms. Lanes and decor were nice. Price was decent for three games and shoes about $15.

Cons: Waitress was a hot mess. Food was weird - got the garlic parmesan wings that tasted like they were buffalo wings fist then someone threw bit of extra seasoning on them. Also got the sample plate with no cheese bread. Took FORVEVE to get drinks.

text: This is where my family goes for good clean fun.

text: Awesome time and even better specials!!! A must go!

name: Denise Ruiz
text:
Overall was a good experience! They spaced you out in lanes which was nice til it was busy. We of course went with kids so it was a bit crazy. Ordered food and was quick as it could be as it was getting busy but with just the one waitress she was so overloaded with people she was slow the busier it got but she def did her best.
The bowling was fun. We didn't play arcade games that day but want to go back to play as they looked fun.

name: Baylee F
text: We went around 5 on Saturday. The employee working the front desk was very rude, didnt greet or speak to either my husband or I, only spoke to tell us to put our card in the chip reader. There were maybe only 7 other lanes in use at this point so they were NOT busy by any means. Went to order 2 drinks and an order of fries around 5:40 and the bar wasnt set up yet I guess? So we ended up waiting over 20 minutes for that order. The place is nice and clean but the staff SERIOUSLY needs to be talked to about customer service. We were completely ignored when we tried to check out as well until a girl walked by (despite there being people behind the desk ignoring us) and asked if we needed to be checked out. We wont be returning, definitely going to try out a different alley next time.

name: Steve Burns
text: Great bowling alley.  Hosts the Pepsi Tournament annually and does a great job.   Large game area, and laser tag room.  Was given a tour of the facility by a friendly and knowledgeable associate. The only negative was extremely slow lane conditioning machines, but that only occurs before tournaments and leagues and does not affect open bowling.

name: Randall Colwell
text: First of all I haven't been here since it was Peach Bowl Lanes and boy was I in for a treat. This place looks and feels amazing. So to get to my experience we scheduled a King Pin Party Package here if you don't know what that is it's amazing what you get for you buck. We had an wonderful time bowling, great food and someone who actually knows how to make good mix drinks lol thanks bartenders. We want to get a BIG Shout Out to our lane server Michaela. She was on top of our party from start to finish never once did we have to search for her and very friendly A+++ service. Our second BIG Shout Out is to the Manager Lorenzo. We had a couple hiccups throughout the night nothing major but he was on top of it and made sure we had the best experience ever, we appreciate that man. Third an last shout out is to the man that set this all up for me over the phone Mr. John Cole. Without you and all your guidance and emails we would have never had this experience. Thanks again. If your looking for a good time and are over the age of 21 and wanna do a group event totally look into the King Pin Package here. I promise you that you won't regret the decision. Want to Thank the Bowlero of Columbus Ga for a great experience. Thank you all.

name: C Policastro
text:
Very large inside and can hold lots of people, great place for parties and hanging out. Bowling is a little expensive when there aren't any specials, at 2 games for $14 that's more than I'm used to spending. But the lanes and balls are in great shape and had no issues, except the lane we played in the 1 pin would fall down about 40% of the time after a reset, so our scores were a bit messed up.

The laser tag is a good size for maybe 5v5, any more and it's chaos unless you just want to sit still and not move around. The guns are clean and "cool" looking and are easy to use and you know when you aren't holding it right when it beeps so it won't shoot.

The bar area is decent size and staff was super friendly and quick service. There was only 1 dart in the board so we couldn't play darts.

I would visit again and bowl just when the games were cheaper.

text:
This is easily my favorite place to go to in the Auburn/Opelika area. They have all the gaming systems I could ever want, a huge library of games, LARPing, D&D, and some really delicious food.

The prices are fantastic too, especially considering the amount of food you get. Oh and those milkshakes. Just get one and thank me later.

Owners are some really down to earth and personable people. Really love this place and have made so many new friends here, I can't believe we haven't had a place like this here sooner.

name: Spencer Sumner
text:
NERDtorch cafe is the next big thing for Opelika/Auburn and people that love video games, anime, and all things nerd culture. Nigel and Leilani run the store and are two of my favorite people. They get to know their customers very well and it makes the atmosphere feel like you're walking in to a good friends house to play the day away with some Smash Bros or Halo.

Leilani makes the best tacos I have ever had in my life. If you get the chance, go to Taco Tuesday. You won't regret it. In fact all the food is delicious. An order of double fries or nachos goes perfect with a D&D session.

Nigel has the uncanny ability to bring fun wherever he goes. He's set up the cafe to accommodate nearly any genre of nerd from retro gamers to hardcore tournament competitors. He's also constantly working to improve his business and make sure everyone that walks in the door has a great time. He also runs a pretty dope YouTube channel called Nerd Torch TV.

The store is organized and managed extremely well. There are several rooms dedicated to different types of gaming. There is a room for tabletop games, another for rhythm games like Guitar Hero or DDR, and other rooms dedicated to console games. There's even a PC built for gaming. Multiplayer games are very popular and this is a great place to find people that love to play Smash. I don't think I've ever been to the cafe when there wasn't someone playing Smash or Mario Cart. There's a great community built up around the cafe as well. All of the cafe members are invited to a GroupMe chat where you can get updates on events or just chat and hang out. This year, they organized a secret santa for everyone.

If you love games, nerds, and having a good time then you won't be dissapointed if drop by NERDtorch Cafe.

resp.text: Thanks so much for writing such a detailed description of NERDtorch Cafe! It means a lot that you would go to such efforts to show your appreciation like this. I'm glad we have you in our community and I know you'll keep making D&D nights awesome.

text: Excellent service and very friendly owner. She certainly knows her video games and has a passion for them. I'd honestly kill for a job like that. The only negative about the place wasn't their fault, and that's that apparently beat saber's commercial license was pulled so my date and I weren't able to play that together.

resp.text: Thank you for those kind words. It was fun watching you and your date have a good time and I loved chatting about video games with you.

name: Matthew Durkovich
text: We took some youth there last night for a Church activity, and I will definitely bring the whole family back! I’ve never done VR, and it was the coolest thing! Their tech is superb, and the cleanliness and professionalism was 10/10. We traded out youth at 30 minutes and the cleaning was awesome. They use UV light (can’t remember the exact kind of UV light) for the headset, and it was all 100% perfect. Be careful, however long you plan to be there, the second you leave you’ll want to go back! They have 50 games covering all interests, and the tutorials and instruction were very helpful. If I can do it, anyone can do it! The staff is super friendly too. Can’t wait to go back!

resp.text: Thank you! It was fun to watch  everyone have  good time. Hope to see you again soon.

text: Took my 11 yr old son and 12 yr old nephew here today for my son’s birthday. Staff was so friendly and helpful. Great place to go if you’re looking for something fun to do with kids, family, or just adults. So many options to choose from. Everything was cleaned prior and after. Staff wore masks, gloves, and checked temperatures at the door. Very clean, safe, and great for social distancing! HIGHLY recommend!!!

resp.text: So glad it was a fun birthday. Thank you!

resp.text: We're so glad you had fun altering your reality with us. Thanks for visiting and we hope to see you soon.

resp.text: Thank you! We loved having you and your son visit. It was great to see your excitement after your session. Please come visit again.

name: Bar Uni
text: It’s so hard finding something safe and fun to do during this horrific time, but this place is beyond awesome. My 8 year old caught right on and enjoyed his time. We will be back. He has the biggest smile on his face.

resp.text: I loved the look on his face when he came out of the headset! Thank you for tying us out.

name: Cameron Barker
text: This place is great. They were extremely welcoming and made sure all health standards were followed. The game selection is amazing and really fun. Much better selection than any other virtual reality store in Huntsville and just an overall fun experience. Honestly it helped me forget COVID for a even a little bit.

resp.text: Thanks for joining us today. We are glad you were able to alter your reality with us!

name: Tuanh Nguyen
text:
The facility is brand new, so all the equipment are new also. They use HTC VIVE headsets and controllers that are wired to the ceiling so there's minimal cord confliction. When you're renting a station (out of the 4 or 5 available), Susanne and Bryce assisted my brother and I with making sure everything was comfortable and adjusted properly for an unhindered experience. The headset and controllers felt clean, so it would be safe to assume they're properly maintained. There's adequate spacing to go with virtual reality setups of course, and oddly enough that also works in favor for social distancing during the pandemic. The staff also enjoy looking for new forms of entertainment to accompany the VR experience, such as planks of wood for you to walk on during tightrope VRs games. Aside from the VR stations themselves, they also have more space available for other parties and what not. You can also rent out the facility ahead of time for a closed group.

While my brother and I had visited the location to see how we felt about VR at all, we in fact ended up enjoying our time there and got to see the lengths of dedication the staff had for their services. We paid $50 total for the both of us for an hour (during their Tuesday to I believe Saturday discount), which feels a slightly expensive but not too heavy for the occasional visit. Personally it felt like we were there for longer since I nearly forgot how to walk after getting familiarized with the controls.

resp.text: We're so glad you stopped in to visit. It was a pleasure to meet you.

name: Chrissie Purcell
text: There are 5 VR sets. Go to the website and book your spot ahead of time.  There are monthly subscription options and options for birthday parties.

resp.text: Thank you for spreading the word about Altered Reality. We hope you enjoyed your visit.

name: James Dickinson
text: A little pricey, but worth it if you don't plan on spending 500 bucks on your own vr set and even more on your own pc. It's reasonable. I would recommend Superhot.

resp.text: Thank you for visiting with us. Keep an eye our for our specials each month to save money and watch for what's coming this summer. Hope to see you soon!

name: Ella Bethel
text: Our first time coming and we enjoyed our self we will be coming back again shortly 👌👌👌

resp.text: Thank you for checking us out. We are glad you had fun and look forward to seeing you again soon.

name: Dave Bullen
text: Friendly, helpful staff. An awesome experience

resp.text: Thank you. We're glad you enjoyed your experience with us and hope to see you soon.

name: Steve Banks
text: I took my daughter here to check it out for an upcoming birthday party and she loved it.  She knew exactly what she wanted to play but I didn't.  The nice thing about that is you can choose from different games in your allotted time.   The owner and staff were great and the controllers and headset were top notch.

resp.text: Thank you! It was nice to meet you. We're so glad you had a good time.

name: Big City Big City
text: Definitely will be back, cool games and even cooler staff!

resp.text: Thanks for stopping by. We're glad you liked your experience with us. See you soon!

name: LISA HARPER CHANG
text: They did a great job with Safety measures and disinfecting, and the headsets worked beautifully! The staff were very helpful and friendly. Highly recommend!

resp.text: Thank you! We're so glad you chose us to celebrate with. It was fun watching your party have a good time. We hope to see you again soon.

name: Maggie Coker
text: Amazing experience with helpful staff.

name: Max Stevens
text: Amazing staff, the few expected multiplayer connection issues between my sister and I were quickly solved and they even added back the time letting us play our game for the full hour. The headsets felt great and fit perfectly on my head, the cord that comes out of it hangs above your head so you have a full unobstructed 10/10 area to play in. Overall great experience!

resp.text: Thanks for checking us out. It was a pleasure having you visit. Hope to see you soon.

name: Kathy B
text: Took the whole family there and had a blast. Staff very friendly and kind. Cost was very reasonable. Will definitely return.

resp.text: Thank you for checking us out. We're so glad you had a good time.

name: Dante
text: Great place that had both single and multiplayer games for our group to try out. Staff was friendly and helped us setup and choose our type of experience. Would recommend for anyone interested in trying out VR for the first time or looking to try out some games you may not have.

resp.text: It was fun having your group visit us. Thanks for checking us out.

name: Jennifer League
text: This was so much fun! The owners are wonderful! We will be back over and over again!

resp.text: Welcome to the Altered Reality family! We are so glad you had a good time and became one of our first members. See you soon!

name: Stephen McConkey
text: I gotta say, first time and I’m impressed, very polite staff, kinda pricy for times but I seen worst and they are fair, the games are limited but some are fun, sometimes there are technically issues but they be sure to pause your timer so it doesn’t go to waste and they go through the effort to try to fix the problem and they make the experience as realistic as possible for the best experience, would recommend trying it again

resp.text: Thank you. It was fun having you visit us today.

name: Jon Michael
text: Took my nephews for a Bday present. Everybody was nice and safe. 10/10 will go again.

resp.text: Thanks for choosing Altered Reality for birthday fun. It was fun to watch you three have a good time.

name: Erika Hardman
text: Had a great time here, played multiple games and enjoyed them all. Staff was very helpful and polite as it was my first VR experience.

resp.text: Thank you! We are glad you had a good time.

name: Kenny B
text: Great experience! Large selection of games with multiplayer options and friendly staff. They have precautions in place for Covid-19 safety compliance. I felt safe knowing that they check everyone's temperature at the door and sanitize the stations after each use. I'll be going back.

resp.text: We're so glad you checked us out. Hope to see you soon.

name: lyellt
text: Great family fun!

resp.text: We're glad you had a great time. Thank you!

name: Crystal
text: Great place!

resp.text: Thank you.
